author: Boone Bergsma
title: The Predictors App - Oracle Service
description: It can be hard to find reliable predictions on the prices of assets, outcome of events, and other things people are interested in knowing.

assessments.note: It is a vague idea of a product with no concrete information regarding customers, how it will be implemented and what these so called predictions will be.
None of the technical documentation or metrics required to effectively address the challenge exist for this proposal

The proposal does not address the challenge sufficiently well as it does not mention a Dapp or integrations with the Cardano blockchain. (there is only mention of an App - not Dapp). It seems that the proposal is still in the idea stage.
Basic information required in the proposal is missing. Technology, skills, experience to assess the proposal is not provided.
It looks like a very interesting topic. But it didn't further demonstrate the problem in detail.

Like the concept - but would have preferred to see how authors look about it within bigger picture. How does it all tie together with goals of community and what benefits can be leveraged from it. Some sense of data that could help us establish this base line would have been really useful. A bit more work, however, is needed to make it investable when taking into account current state of being.
There is no information about the expertise of the proposer and how he plans to execute the suggested product.
This proposal includes no development roadmap or detailed project plan. Its unclear how this proposal will implement a dApp on Cardano in the next 6 months.

To me, one of the glaring weaknesses of this proposal is the lack of verifiable experience in terms of Dapp development and integrations with blochain technologies. The plan is barebones at best, lacking completely at worst.
Experience ans skills required for implementing solution is not showcased.
It didn't explain clearly about its experience and background of team.  There is no breakdown or clear demonstration to explain how the 10000USD will be used.

I am afraid this is just a concept. It doesn't really have any sensible plan in place just yet outside of the brainstorming of the idea. I like the concept - but it would help to understand this plan better and knowing the budget breakdown. How does this budget help us achieve what we are going to set out here to do. How are we going to make it happen. I recognise two very well known community members - hence I am surprised not to read more about their experiences that are relevant for this project. For someone who may not be familiar - this would be key to understand. Unsure why this wasn't included in a greater capacity.
There is no information about the expertise of the proposer and how he plans to execute the suggested product.
This proposal is lacking basic detail required.

Probably the greatest general weakness of this proposal is that it does not  provide sufficient information to assess how feasible it is and how effectively it addresses the challenge. It seems to be still in an idea stage. This should not discourage the proposer from taking a new approach and fleshing out his proposal for future funding rounds.
The feasibility of the solution cannot be assessed as required information is not provided.
There is no roadmap or milestones to specify step by step plan. The objective is too board and it didn't explain how to assess success.

Absent of formal proposal details - we don't really have any roadmap or milestones to lean onto. Nor do authors look into some success metrics and how this could be measured. Some sense of KPIs, maybe talking about challenges as well as risks? All of these would add more colour into the proposal. It is not there presently, sadly.

solution: With The Predictors APP you can crowdsource the data you need to make better decisions, you can win prizes from making correct predictions.
experience: Predictions markets are growing in popularity and crowdsourced data can provide wisdom and insights to people, businesses, organizations.
